pages.text: Ores and minerals in NTM are many. Each one is used in the production of variety of machines and are useful conditionally.$(br2)Its not necessary to gather everything you find. But it is still good practice to mine some so you have a few when the need arises.

The next several pages show the ores you can find in the world, what do they look like and where to find them.$(br2)Some ores are distributed evenly and some are distributed triangularly.$(br2)Triangular distribution means you'll find most of that ore in the middle of the highest and lowest points it can be found.

$(2)Uranium$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=10 with a density of 22 veins per chunk, in a triangular distribution.$(br2)Alternatively it can be found in $(2)Mountain$() biomes between Y=5 and Y=50 with a density of 13, with even distribution.
pages.title: Uranium

pages.text: Uranium Ore in Stone.

$(2)Thorium$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-20 and Y=30 with a density of 14 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Alternatively it can be found in $(2)Mountain$() biomes between Y=60 and Y=200 with a density of 30, in a triangular distribution. But 80% of it being unexposed to air.
pages.title: Thorium

pages.text: Thorium Ore in Stone.

$(2)Titanium$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=35 with a density of 18 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Additional veins can be found between Y=-25 and Y=35 with a density of 8, in a triangular distribution.
pages.title: Titanium

pages.text: Titanium Ore in Stone.

$(2)Sulfur$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=35 with a density of 16 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Additional veins can be found in $(2)Savanna$() and $(2)Badlands$() biomes between Y=5 and Y=35 with a density of 5, with even distribution.
pages.title: Sulfur

pages.text: Sulfur Ore in Stone.

$(2)Niter$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=35 with a density of 19 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Additional veins can be found in $(2)Savanna$() and $(2)Badlands$() biomes between Y=5 and Y=35 with a density of 6, with even distribution.
pages.title: Niter

pages.text: Niter Ore in Stone.
$(2)Tungsten$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=35 with a density of 29 veins per chunk, with even distribution.
pages.title: Tungsten

pages.text: Tungsten Ore in Stone.
$(2)Aluminium$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=45 with a density of 17 veins per chunk, with even distribution.
pages.title: Aluminium

pages.text: Aluminium Ore in Stone.

$(2)Fluorite$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=50 with a density of 7 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Additional veins can be found between Y=-30 and Y=50 with a density of 7, in a triangular distribution.
pages.title: Fluorite

pages.text: Calcite Block.

$(2)Beryllium$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=35 with a density of 13 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Additional veins can be found between Y=-60 and Y=-15 with a density of 6, in a triangular distribution.
pages.title: Beryllium

pages.text: Beryllium Ore in Stone.

$(2)Lead$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-60 and Y=35 with a density of 13 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Additional veins can be found between Y=-10 and Y=35 with a density of 6, in a triangular distribution.
pages.title: Lead

pages.text: Lead Ore in Stone.

$(2)Lignite$() is a type of low-grade $(2)Coal$(). Found in large veins between Y=35 and Y=60.$(br2)In $(2)Swamp$() biomes can be found at +100% the rate of normal.$(br2)Alternatively it can be found between Y=80 and Y=160 at +150% the rate of normal. But 70% of it being unexposed to air.
pages.title: Lignite

pages.text: Lignite Ore in Stone.
$(2)Asbestos$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=16 and Y=32 with a density of 4 veins per chunk, with even distribution.
pages.title: Asbestos

pages.text: Asbestos Ore in Stone.

$(2)Rare Earth Ore$() can be found in overworld between Y=-5 and Y=25 with a density of 9 veins per chunk, with even distribution.$(br2)Alternatively it can be found between Y=-60 and Y=20 with a density of 12, with even distribution. But 40% of it being unexposed to air.
pages.title: Rare Earth Minerals

pages.text: Rare Earth Ore in Stone.
$(2)Cobalt$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=-4 and Y=12 with a density of 4 veins per chunk, with even distribution.
pages.title: Cobalt

pages.text: Cobalt Ore in Stone.
$(2)Cinnabar$() is a common overworld ore that can be found between Y=8 and Y=24 with a density of 1 vein per chunk, with even distribution.
pages.title: Cinnabar

pages.text: Cinnabar Ore in Stone.

$(2)Oil$() is a rare overworld resource that can be found between Y=32 and Y=64 once every 128 chunks, with even distribution.$(br2)You cannot mine it with conventional means, instead you need a $(t:[Not Yet Implemented])$(9)Oil Derrick$() to extract oil.
pages.title: Oil

pages.text: Oil in Stone.

$(2)Coltan$() is a special overworld ore that can be found between Y=15 and Y=40 within 750m circular radius of a set position.$(br2)The deposit is centered on a randomly generated position that is determined by the world seed. This center can be at most 1500m away from spawn.$(br2)You need a $(t:[Not Yet Implemented])$(9)Coltass$() to locate the worlds only coltan deposit.
pages.title: Coltan

pages.text: Coltan Ore in Stone.
$(2)Australium$() is a special overworld ore that can be found between Y=15 and Y=30 within 100m square radius of X=-400 Z=-400, with a estimated size of 490 ores.
pages.title: Australium

pages.text: Australium Ore in Stone.
